metadata.title: Critical Role RPG Show Q&A and Battle Royale!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's pseudo-episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy voice actors will be answering your questions and then doing a fantastic battle royale showdown between Pike, Vax, Keyleth, and Percy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Woo-hoo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If we want to get through those, I probably should have loaded them up on my phone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, Let me see if I can beat you to that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You want to get to that right now. But in the meantime, this comes to our fourth and final week of this run, being sponsored by Loot Crate, who've been fantastic for this month run of Critical Role. It's our first time trying out a sponsorship. You guys have been awesome in checking out their stuff, and I hope a lot of you guys have enjoyed becoming part of the Loot Crate membership family. We are!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you can get $3 off your subscription with code 'criticalrole'.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, at www.lootcrate.com/criticalrole. I talk for a living. Anyway, what else do we want to announce this evening?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, the Dear Vox Machina article series has been going on on Friday nights. Wait, whose came out last?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, I thought it was.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think mine's coming out tomorrow. I think Keyleth is tomorrow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I better get mine turned in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You should probably turn yours in. You should probably do your work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I should probably turn mine in too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jeez, fucking slackers. Galavanting in Hawaii.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, whatever, getting a tan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, a burn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I do have to point out, strong appreciation for Taliesin to really fly the true nerd banner by having a trip to Hawaii and spending a portion of it in his hotel room playing D&D on Skype.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was a beautiful sunset happening right offscreen. My friends who I'm sharing a room with were like-- "We're going snorkeling!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Got to kill a dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's pretty great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then your first episode of Signal Boost went live on Tuesday.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yay! My first episode of Signal Boost went-- oh, ow, that hurt-- live on Tuesday!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't burn yourself!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to burn us down. This whole game is coming down now. Yeah, you should check it out. I'm really proud of it, and I'm happy with it, and there's more fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good, I'm glad! I'm glad you're not totally embarrassed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mortified.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's uncanny.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I finally splurged on your episodes, Marisha. I did. And I've liked all of the things that you liked. Now I'm going to watch Hector's.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We should all like bees, really.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bees are great. Bees or die.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I will have a hive soon, it is happening. It's being built right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right next door to the chickens?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Love the bees at a distance!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, they're very nice. They're sweet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What other announcements have we got?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's it. No one else added anything else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I have a quick announcement. Those who haven't seen or had an opportunity to play yet, this week had the launch of Overwatch, Blizzard's new game. I'm lucky enough to play the character McCree, the space cowboy. You guys get to have an opportunity to shoot a six-shooter in the game and tell people (McCree voice), "It's high noon." If you haven't played it, you should, it's a lot of fun. I have enjoyed the

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's so good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You bring it on yourself just saying that catchphrase.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I get tweeted pretty much at every time zone's noon. Every day, people barrage me with, "Hey Matt, what time is it?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Every time zone! Once an hour on the hour! What time is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's about four o'clock, why? Oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And not to be confused with MacCready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, apparently any gun-slinging guys with McCree in their name have been me this past year.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you got the cornerstone. McCree, MacCready, and then what is the name of your character in Evolve, which is also a cyber space cowboy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Space cowboy, that's Abe. (Abe voice) Abraham Presley. Yeah, guys in hats with guns has been a theme this past year, some of them with really great facial hair. I love that theme.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I haven't hit it yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's so good, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going to have to sync up and play it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be a thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway! We've got questions to get to. So, first and foremost, we have a few sources of questions. Obviously we're not going to get to a lot of them tonight, because there's a lot of questions. But there's a Reddit thread that's been up for a little while, we're going to be pulling questions from there. The chat room as well, we have at our side here. We have questions coming from you guys there as long as we can keep track of it because it goes pretty fast. Is my mic bad, not getting a good mic? I'll lean this way then and try and get to this section. Should work fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You could adjust the boom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, but the camera is there. Karen?

lines.name: KAREN
lines.text: You're very audible. They're just being picky.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're apologizing now for all of us looking at our phones. It's not because we're bored, it's because we want to answer your questions.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's where the questions are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ermagerd, querstions!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This comes from Groghammer on Reddit. "After the episode 'Cows and Consequences', Matt said it "was one of the weirdest, but not the weirdest, D&D experience he's ever had. To him and others with "experience, what is the weirdest thing that's happened in a game you've played?" This is an interesting question.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Offscreen, I guess? Outside of 'Cows and Consequences'?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This was when I was running the Ravenloft game for a few years with my old group back in the late 2000s. As they began to make their way through Barovia, the atmosphere of it was drawing them down and every night they'd sleep there, they would take corruption similarly to how you did when you were in Whitestone under the watch of the Briarwoods. We had our bard begin to grow sharpened teeth. We had our rogue character, who had a long-dormant mummy rot that had been subsiding in his body begin to spread again. We had our blood mage, who had died and been resurrected, came back not quite right and went a little feral. And then we had our paladin, whose skin all of a sudden was pulled tighter against his body, and as a person whose whole ideal was to fight undead, to look in the mirror one day and see that he resembled one, he went crazy and started smashing stuff. It was a cool buildup, but one of the weirder, fun experiences was when they had finally finished the battle with Strahd, when they had defeated him and, in theory, saved Ravenloft, the epilogue ended up being a "at what "cost?" circumstance. Well, the cleric died in the final battle, the paladin killed himself, the blood mage disappeared into the forest and was never seen again. The rogue, who was like the older Indiana Jones character of the group, took the castle for himself and became the new lord of Barovia, Batman-style, supposedly to watch over the city, but his corruption had gotten so heavy that it wasn't sure if they were replacing one monster with another. And the bard, who had had a constant feud with the rogue, got, in the final moments of the game, in a huge argument post-battle, and the rogue grabbed him and tore his tongue out. And the bard now served him as this mute, subservient Gollum figure and was at the edge of his throne in the epilogue as the rogue took the throne of Barovia for himself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like an Edward Gorey poem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pretty much. It was a hell of an end to that campaign.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The bard went full-on Theon Greyjoy style?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of, unintentionally. That was my friend Shaun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yes, of course. That makes perfect sense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How about you guys?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got so enraptured in that story, I'm trying to think--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can mine be from Mansions of Madness? Can mine be from board games?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, this is any game.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm partial to the time where I was playing as Ashcan Pete, who's my favorite character to play as in any Cthulhu universe. I was down to one hit point, had lost my weapon, and was hiding in a chest. And I popped out of a chest and punched a shoggoth and killed him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, last hit point. It was the hobo jack-in-the-boxing and punching a shoggoth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The old hobo jack-in-the-box technique! And it was great, and I'll never forget it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ashcan Pete.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ashcan! Who can? Ashcan!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you, that was all I hoped for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any of you guys?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My tabletop is high school, which I don't remember too well. And then our home game, the show was far crazier than our home game was. As fun as the home game was, nothing as lunatic as the cow episode--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I wasn't a part of that cow episode, but I remember watching it, and I was like, "This is "ludicrous." I was laughing so hard, I had projectile tears. I was like, "This is the "weirdest thing that's happened in this game."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was pretty legitimate-- hopefully this will work better for audio, thank you so much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's forever colored both of those rides.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to see, is there a Barovia travel poster out there? Someone has to have made something like that, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I hope so, like a pamphlet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. "Come visit sunny Barovia!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ashley, what classes would the cast of Blindspot "be in your opinion?" From Zodaru in the chatroom.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think Zapata would be a rogue. I would probably be a bard or probably still a cleric.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah? You said so on the show.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, so I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was my favorite in-joke I've ever seen in television from a nerd point ever. Those who haven't seen it, there's an episode of Blindspot where Ashley's character gets teased about playing your wizard and elf game. And you correct them with--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's called Dungeons and Dragons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm actually a gnome cleric. And I was like, "Yes!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Put it in where we can. Just stick it right in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a way to put it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Outreach, our outreach campaign.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Liam, did you find a question you wanted to tackle?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Um.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know, they're coming in fast. Coming in hot!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Within the actual narrative of Critical Role, do you believe your character could ever be capable "of seriously fighting or killing another party member, and if so, what would it take to reach "that point?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think it would take a lot, and I got a lot of static after Vax punched Percy. A week later, everyone's like, "Like Vax has any horse to stand on, with what happened with his sister." First of all, that was what was running through my head as I punched Percy. None of you had to tell me about that, that's what I was thinking about. And if that hadn't happened, I probably would have done more than punch him one time. I probably would have went a little bit further. But I would say, on one hand, Vax thinks it's a little different because Vax rushed in to try to save his sister, not exactly the same situation. But on the other hand, you're kind of right, he doesn't have any moral high ground, and I'm not trying to play anyone on moral high ground. And I thought, do I have the right to do this? Probably not, who cares? We're all playing imperfect people.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Percy would absolutely kill another member of Vox Machina if he thought that it was for the good of the whole group. He thought if there was a situation where it was like, put one down because they were a threat to everybody else, he'd probably be okay. Probably.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, Keyleth has a hard time killing the scum of the earth. So no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I couldn't kill Trinket. I think I'd feel really bad. I couldn't live with myself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter, bear grunting)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know if Pike could do it. Even if they were really bad or something was terrible, I feel like Pike would try anything to not kill one of the members.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You should stay in that mindset after the break.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, I will not! Tonight is an exception, my friend!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, Sarenrae, part of her sphere of influence is redemption, too. With Pike, I could see her, definitely. She feels that even somebody's who's fallen that far from what she knew, she could find a way to bring them back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, there's still something in them that should still be there. I don't think there's anything that can make her kill somebody. Except tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Except tonight. There you go, we'll have it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tonight's special.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyone find any questions they prefer for this one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a good one. This is from @CaraKiriyama on Twitter, "If the characters "hadn't found each other and formed Vox Machina, what do you think they'd be doing instead?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Percy'd be dead by now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth might be dead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He would have walked into something stupid and that would have been the end of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think the twins would have been doing mercenary work somewhere.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth would try and continue on her Aramente, by herself if she had to, maybe find other people to pal around with along the way. She tagged along with you guys because she was afraid that she'd die out there alone, which, once again, probably would've.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like Pike would've probably stayed, hanging out in the Bramblewood, living with Wilhand. I feel like she's pretty small-town, I think this is such a huge adventure for Pike, and the only thing that brought Pike out of it was because of Grog, was a family, and being like, "Well, I guess I'll leave, try to help him and find him." I don't think she would've explored that much, she would've stayed. So Vox Machina brought out the best!

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: (singing) Just a small town girl, living in a lonely world! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is now your theme song.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, such a good theme song!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he told the DM, "This is the moment." And he systematically killed each member of the party, took their heads, preserved their heads, still living, and put them on the shelf in his now-dark tower. And that was the end of the campaign, he ended up TPKing the rest of his own party and putting them on the shelf.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bless Shaun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shaun's an interesting character. Actually, I think I'm seeing him this weekend at MomoCon in Atlanta. See you in a few days, Shawn! (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like it would be so fun to be an evil character.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to do a one-off sometime that goes further than the goblin game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That can be arranged. Next time we have a day off like this and people can't make it, whoever's around, we'll do an evil one-shot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (evil voice) We should do an evil one-shot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know what that character is for that game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That makes me happy. Chat room, let's see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: @LChow on Twitter says, "Who comes up with and assigns the episode titles?" I think this is a funny story. Mainly, they come out organically.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I have my own titles when I give the adventure preparation for each session in the actual documents in my folder. But then when the episodes happen, that very much informs what the episode titles are. Usually, it's--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like "At Dawn, We Plan."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was so, I was like, "This has got to be it."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We all walk out and go like, "Well, that's the title."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The titles come out the next Monday morning, Taliesin texting or emailing me at 11:30 AM.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, we need a title now, you've got 20 minutes. Good morning, what's up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And I'll be in the middle of a session like, "Okay, bathroom break? Okay. Ooh, that'll be "good." And that's all it is.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I actually didn't know that. I didn't know that you thought of the titles. Because they're fantastic.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you got the bird's-eye view, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the thing, I'd feel a little weird if somebody I didn't know did the titles. Like the last episode that came out, somebody was like, "The Dragon Episode," I'd be like, "Hmm." I'm not saying that would be the case, whoever would possibly do the titles here at Geek & Sundry, but I'm a little attached.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It makes sense, I don't know who else I thought would've done it besides you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We can do a vote.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Draw lots.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We do most everything ourselves.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are free to think I have a death wish. I don't have a death wish, I don't want to roll a new character, I love my character, but I'm not going to play him like an accountant. I'm going to rush in and try to save people and kill the motherfuckers who killed my parents, my mother, I don't have a father.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He could die next week, and I'll be bummed for a while, but this is how I'm going to play him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Would you cry? I would cry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I would cry so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We cried so hard when you died that one time.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was horrible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I survive next week's game, I will do something just as dumbfuck two to five episodes later, so strap in. That's what I'm doing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not like we have a plan. I think people assume we have plans.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, first off, no plan survives contact with the enemy, this is the general term. And also, that's what D&D is about. There have been many games that I've played where I could do the smart, safe move, but then I stop myself and go, "Why?" To me, I'd rather try something spectacular and fail spectacularly than keep it safe and on its own. And even if a character could possibly die, those are the moments that you remember.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's the video game from Rick and Morty? I'm trying to remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, the one where he goes and lives the life?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're taking him off the grid, he doesn't have his Social Security card! (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The game can be different things for different people, and if people want to treat it like a WoW raid, go for it, have fun with that. But if I had to be like, "Okay, how I can max out my "opportunities here and my chance to get my Devout--," that's not why I play. I play to stick myself in epic books that I loved reading as a kid. And sometimes characters die.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Many of those people in those books die.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like we've all become the characters so much.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Someone else asked how long did it take to create your characters, and I feel like it's still happening. The first game was like, "Yeah, I'm a rogue! We're twins? Cool! Okay, what "do I do? I sneak around, Grog doesn't even know that he can do whatever the hell he wants, great." It's so loosey-goosey.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's such an Urban Outfitter inspirational poster: "Our stories are never over." (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's still ripening. And sometimes we have one-on-one conversations with each other or in a group, we feel like we're learning new things about the character-- every game-- or each other, or ourselves even, playing this game.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, he's totally act two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You two especially have had some interesting changes. You changed from pre-stream to stream because of your whole experience on the ship, and after death, Pike has become a lot more hardened and accepting of the harshness of reality, and that's been cool to watch that happen.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's been fun. I almost still feel like Pike is a little bit of act one. Even with everything that's happening, I'm still a little like, "Ooh, there's more there."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Waiting for that big break to happen.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, but it's getting there. Someone asked what led to Ashley and Travis deciding to link their backstories together? That was actually not my decision.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was how you hooked her in.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was how he put it together, which I thought was really cool because I came to the second game that you guys played?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it was the second game. Travis couldn't be there for the second game, so I worked it into the story-- I didn't give you exactly what it was, but I said, "If you want to tie it into "why Travis can't be there with his character, how would you want to work these together?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Which is so crazy because how our friendship in-game has turned out is so huge in the game for me. Which I wonder if that wasn't the story, how different that would have been. But that's such a huge part of the story for me. So crazy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It evolves in a really strange way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vax has a-- wishing he could follow a bit in her footsteps, or did, and I don't want to get too much into that, and obviously all this. I didn't have any beef with you at any time in the past, but now I don't trust you as far as I can throw you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good, that's a really good decision.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog and Vax never had any real digging at each other, but it's a little dicier now. They're okay, but a little bit of--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One of these days, me and you, our ideals are going to come to a crashing head.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm curious. There's so many things that are on the cusp of happening.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's a lot of things. Because I haven't even gotten to deal with this motherfuck yet about what's been going on with him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm a cutter, I've been cutting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dagger dagger dagger.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Him being Vax, not Liam.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm Vex.

lines.name: MATT, MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't fuck with her. You're right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How long have we been playing this game for?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But still, the split-second where I was like, shit, I got it wrong. No, I didn't!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, the players came up with a very interesting plan, formed two of the smallest possible members into a creature that is so large that I considered in that moment that there would be enough space where you wouldn't be occupying technically the same space as the creature. So I allowed it for that circumstance. Most of the time, yes, they would be shunted out, and if you'd rolled a lower intelligence roll, you probably would have been pushed out the side. But as a Dungeon Master, you have to justify things, consider what makes sense versus what doesn't, how much do the mechanics written in the rules rule your game in the narrative, and how much you want to allow because the players have been creative or it's an interesting way that could make sense and you can justify. I chose in that moment to justify that, and it didn't necessarily work in their favor in some ways, but that's the nature of making weird, cool plans and seeing if they come to fruition or not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Still a fun game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That doesn't mean you have to. You can be angry that I didn't follow the rules. I thought it was fun and cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure you did. There's a rule in the rulebook that says bend the rules whenever you want to bend the rules. That's a rule. So Matt followed the rules.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is actually a cool question. This is for Matt, and I would like to know this. Has there been something in-game that's happened that has absolutely shocked you? Where you were like, this is something that's never happened in a game I've DMed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (explosion) It was, from a narrative standpoint, really cool how it played out, but I wasn't expecting that to happen at all. It was going to be one other annoyance and warning of the power behind this artifact, and it just happened that way.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was the worst.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We all felt like such assholes about that. We were all like, wow, that was dumb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to end my game, I'm ending it, Laura's going to go on, I'm out. Just like I planned. And you went-- flipped it on me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's what I do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All my ideas for the future went (pfft).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Had to change everything I was thinking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A couple of key rolls in that fight. The Grog escape, the broom escape, using the necklace in a way that I never considered it to be used. That was-- the way you guys planned that battle worked out almost perfectly to just barely save your asses, because that fight was one of the harder encounters I'd ever developed, and it was more like I wasn't sure how it was going to go down. I had three other maps on the side in case you guys had a sewer journey, if you guys wanted to stealth in during the night and assassinate Kevdak in his room attempt, or find a way to try and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That would've been a good idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow, fuck, why didn't we think of that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There were different ways this could have worked. The way this all went down, I left it open to see what you guys were going to do, and this was possibly the hardest way to handle it, but it also ended up being one of the most dynamic and cinematic, so I was excited how it worked out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was such a back-and-forth, too, because we were like, okay, here's what we're going to try to do, shit, it's working, it's working, we got this, we got this! And then it went (explosion) and flipped into 180, and we're like, we're dead, we're dead, and then a Hail Mary pass at the last second. Ripping expectations back and forth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If anybody had got the death blow aside from Grog, they wouldn't have stopped. That was the sad and scary part. Because it's one thing having an old member of the herd that challenged him dealing the death blow to give them pause and really consider, has this power move shifted, is he the new leader? That was enough to cause everyone to stop and really consider the situation, and with Zanror being brought forth and released, it put them into this tense period of-- not subservience or respecting or accepting the new rule, but not really knowing what to do because their leader was gone, and the one who challenged and killed him in a spectacular death, and it gave them pause. If it was a shitty half-elf that ran up and stabbed their ruler--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From their perspective, you guys were shitty half-elves, all right? And a shitty gnome, and a shitty human.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey! Rude.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would've continued in their mind to be an aggressive act, and they would've continued to steamroll you. That was so crazy. Anyway, yeah, we should answer another question.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Similar kinds of things happened with the dragon, though, where it was like, this is going well, this is going pretty well-- oh, shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's going not well at all. This is very not good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Once again, internet, I think-- everyone's like, well, pretty much everything that could've went wrong did. That pretty much--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's so not true. So many things that could've gone wrong didn't.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We did pretty well, considering.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm a ground fighter. If I'd been on the ground, I'd probably be goo in shoes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you guys had not managed to-- the whole mechanic I'd used was if the trap succeeded, based on the dragon's perception roll and how well you guys hid things-- had the dragon even noticed there was something different and wrong, it wouldn't have landed. It would've stayed up there and started spraying you guys down. Maybe throwing spells. It would've been bad.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We did pretty well, considering.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Considering. And you holding it to the ground was important, because it prevented it-- because its breath weapon is a line, it limited its range and what any powerful dragon does to its advantage is stays in the air and uses-- Those few rounds were key. Once it did get free, you saw how fast it could turn in a negative position for a group. And the chains were good. It sacrificed damage, but it also raised the DC of its ability to escape from the grapple that was holding it on the ground. You guys did a really good job and had some rolls going in your favor, but once it started turning over and it escaped, it went south very quick.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we have him on the run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have him on the run. Kind of?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was the worst cliffhanger of a game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know! It wasn't my intent! I had to sleep.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know, I know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Someone asked a question, when are you getting shirts on Geek and Sundry that says 'Your 'Fun Is Wrong'?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) I don't know. That's a polarizing term in the community. I'm glad and I'm excited that people are passionate enough to be so invested that they are frustrated that things they came up with didn't happen, or that they saw circumstances that outside of the game could have worked. To me, I think those discussions are great. There are some people that take it too far and actually make verbal attacks on the players via social media, or go out of their way to use those circumstances to really be unfairly dark and necessarily down on us, and I'm like, those are shitty. And those are more of what that's referring to. But overall, I love the discussion, and I think it's great. Everyone will handle a situation differently, and I love people who will have those talks. So I don't know if the #yourfuniswrong is in a good enough spirit to put on a shirt. I do eventually want to do a 'You Can Certainly Try' shirt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think 'You Can Certainly Try' is next.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that's the darkest thing that we ever hear in the game. "You can certainly try."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) I love it so much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll roll my die to spite you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From GeekSpiral on reddit. For Ashley. "Do the Blindspot writers work out the Critical Role "references with you, or do they sneak it in themselves?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They asked-- when I brought the mug to set, because I asked them, I was like, "I want to "have one mug that my character uses." And they were like, "Okay, pick out a mug," and I was like, oh, I already have one. And I brought the Critical Role mug and they were like, "Oh, cool. What is "this?" And I was like, "Just the coolest thing ever. Don't worry about it. This is what I'm "using." But then I couldn't do it for so many episodes because it had to be cleared by NBC. And they're like, "Well, what is this Critical Role?" And I'm like, "Well!" So I had to go through and, they're like, "Can we use it?" I was like, "Of course." Yeah. And I was like, "Well, it's a "Dungeons & Dragons game I play with my friends--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, no, it's not like on TV.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not the email.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It was like my favorite day at work. My favorite episode, yeah. My favorite scene that I shot. So I was like, that made my day. Made my day!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Talk to me in a year. But I do it at home. It's great. My kids love it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Legitimately.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's one thing to play a game. It's another to play it on the internet where a lot of people can tell you immediately what you did wrong. But we're still having fun.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So far.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I like this one. Somebody asked, "What do you think is your character's biggest fault?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I saw that rolling through. It's a good one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you think is your biggest fault, guys?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like some of them are apparent, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That you can say.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our biggest fault. I guess her tragic flaw? Extreme self-loathing and guilt. Fairly transparent on that one there, I think. Yeah, Keyleth pretty much hates everything she does and feels worthless. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. (laughs) To bring it up on you, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Someone also said, "Is it fair to call Percy the Doctor Doom of his world?" No, he is definitely the Reed Richards of his world. And if you read Fantastic Four, you will know that Reed Richards is a terrible person. He's a terrible, terrible person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like that. You, Vax?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I think that Vax has a little bit of self-loathing, too. I don't know, people think that Vax thinks he's a Boy Scout. I don't. And I don't think he does either. For the backstory, I was a thief for years. I did shitty things and stole from people so he could get by. I think he at this point in life feels like he's been a fuck-up and a waste of time most of his life, and the only good thing he's had in his whole life is his relationship with his sister, which is like one, good, true thing. But everything else, they're dead-enders.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, he's not!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, maybe. Maybe things are changing. But that's what he was. And then also he follows his heart now, to a fault.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. And you, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Gosh. Pike is-- Perfect. Just no faults whatsoever. No. Gosh. I think that with the death that was before the stream, I think she felt like she was not as helpful in the group, and I think that sticks with her, with trying to be like, "I need to earn my place!" Yeah, I don't know. She's got some weird stuff with her family, which we haven't really gotten into, because she comes from the deep gnomes. They're a little bit of tricksters. Hence the last name Trickfoot. It probably would be the equivalent of coming from-- I don't want to say that, because it sounds so judgmental. Never mind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're all degenerates. We're all fuck-ups.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And that's what we love about them. None of us are trying to be white as snow. Even those of us who think they mean the most good for the world, we're all fuck-ups. We're going to continue to fuck up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. I'm going to do a couple quick Twitter questions here rapid-fire, so we can get through some of these. Taliesin, did Matt tell you about the demon in the gun, or when did he?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, he didn't tell. I found out when you did! Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) He knew Orthax, or he knew that some sort of smoke entity had attached to him and made an offer, but you didn't know what bound it to you, and it was the weapon, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing at all. I didn't even know. I left it open to have just been nothing. It could have just been that he had a dream one night and went nuts. It literally could have been nothing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You clever bastard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fun. The fact that Sam caught up on that and got rid of it was one of my favorite character moments for him. Because that was going to stick around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want my gun back!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No you don't! You do not need it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Build a new one!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I haven't had time! Everything keeps exploding!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. (laughs) It keeps exploding?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If something could stop blowing up for five minutes, I'll finish four projects around the house. Waffle iron.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's so many questions. Ooh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's a lot of questions. Any you want to pick up on?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, I've already asked a lot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Laura says by text, is the chat not working?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Chat's working.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe their video is broken.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Chat's working, La.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hi, Laura! Hi, Twavis!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hi! Are you guys on the other side of the planet now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that was very impressive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here's a question that I actually get a lot. This was from @tiamat_zx on Twitter. Why was Keyleth hostile towards Kima in the past? In the very beginning?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shifty eyes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not necessarily where she comes from, and I think she's had a few bad experiences. Enough in the past to where she's seen the corruption of a church. And at the time, Kima was full-heartedly running into a blaze of glory and death and we were sent there to go grab her with really no other lead on who she actually was or what she actually wanted. I didn't trust that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's not exactly Miss Charming either, is she?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. And I think we happened to have two personality types. Like, Keyleth and Kima had two personality types that butted heads.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It's true. Question here real fast: @matthewmercer, do you discuss the night's events in the car ride home or days later, together with Marisha, I guess is what they're referring to? Yeah, on the ride home, we'll definitely be like, "That was crazy." And we'll recall events that happened, and she'll mention things or ask questions, and I'll say, "I don't know," and she'll get angry at me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's mainly most of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Calm down about Keyleth, guys. She's having a fun time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're not deciding laws in the Supreme Court. We're being doofuses.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm the awkward, unlikeable one. I get it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the interesting point was, we were talking about that. It was like, "Why is there "this polarizing anger about Keyleth out there?" And I think a lot of it may come from the fact that you are, your character by nature is, an awkward character, who isn't the heroic, grandstanding hero, isn't the trickster, Han Solo rogue, and as that personality type, against a banner of other characters who fit more in those realms.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's stick a Miyazaki princess in the middle of the show and see what happens. That'll be great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tatted up the sleeves, and Princess Mononoke dropped in the middle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Completely unbiased, from a DM's standpoint.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like everybody. I'm horrified by the thought of losing any of us--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm horrified and excited.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know that sounds awful, but from a narrative standpoint-- I'm never going to force it, by any means, so if people are like, "Matt killed someone." I'm like, I'm not going to kill anybody on purpose. I'm going to let circumstances work out. So far there have been a couple close calls. One of these days, one of those dice is going to roll lower than that resurrection DC.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Close calls are getting closer and closer together, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. Hey! Stakes are escalating, guys!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you give us a list of the easiest encounters to the hardest? Or could you put a skull next to the super-hard ones like in Fallout, where you're not supposed to go near the bad guy because the skull is floating there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's an ancient dragon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I didn't want to fight it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought we weren't, and then suddenly, oh, this is happening now!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We need to go get some of these things and come back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: About fighting the dragon?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah! I said it like 20 times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey, man, depending on how this works out, some lessons will be learned, and hopefully prepare you for the next encounter a little better. Depending on who's left.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't like the sound of that. "How this turns out." I know, maybe we let him-- after we get you out, run.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're going to be so angry at us, those dragons.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It would be really interesting with this group, though, if someone did have to reroll a character, since we all do already know each other so well. That would be a very interesting dynamic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like it'd be like transferring high schools, and you're the new kid in class, walking in for the first time, and you're like, "Hey."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, the whole cast is this-- we're all very ripened, mature characters with lots of nuance, and the first one will be like, "Hey, I'm a new bard! Where are my spells?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've had that legitimate fear, because when we came into this, we were already two years into our characters, and I was like, jeez, it took us a while to find them and make them as deep and complex as they are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Although when you play every week, we used to play every six weeks, so things were a little shallower at home, and now...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's going to be interesting.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's make it not happen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Just make sure you pay attention to the lore and the previous experiences you've had with dangerous entities.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is a lot of lore, Matt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like he's feeding us hints.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For the first time ever, I feel like Matt is actually--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've told you nothing, I just like messing with you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Somebody asked how you and I avoid awkwardness in real life after Vax and Keyleth moments.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You guys are really awkward. It's weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who are you, the chat room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're pretty cool with it. It's like an acting gig, really.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we're mature adults, I think.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're all like, how do you feel?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I will say that Liam and I walked away, we were like, "Wait. No one flinched at a "Scanlan and Pike scene." No one flinched.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not at all. Everyone crawled inside their own assholes when we had our--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think because you guys had the maiden voyage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's right. We were pioneers.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You were the pioneers, and we all learned from that moment of, oh, you can have moments like these, and everybody has to not be 12 about it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was like that moment when you first get to prison and they put you on the wall and take the hose and bring it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, stings!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, do you maybe want to go out sometime, I kind of like you, ow!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know, we were the worst. We were the worst.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to pull up another Reddit question here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Laura and/or Travis.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're not here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll answer for Travis.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll answer for Laura.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. You guys should do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Grog voice) What? What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wink. Wink. Wink.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see. "Ashley. Do you prefer as a player to watch things unfold, or do you want to "be in the driver's seat more? Also, would you ever convert anyone to worshipping Sarenrae?" From Jojorious on Reddit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think, for me personally, I still feel a little like a newbie, in a way, because they've played so many games consistently, week after week, and because of work, I still feel a little rusty. So for me, there's a part of me, not as Pike, that likes to watch things unfold first before making a move, because I'm like, can I do this? I'm a little unsure sometimes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's Pike or that's Ashley, you're saying?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's Ashley. But I think I feel like Pike is the same way, but I feel like these things blur together. But I think with Pike, it's almost better to hang back because of being a cleric, because you can do a little clean-up after. Just, who's hurt, who can we protect and keep alive and keep in the battle? There was another part to the question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, would you ever convert anyone to worshipping Sarenrae?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, yes. Probably not. I feel like with Pike there's a lot of-- which we've had so many times talks in the game and out of game about how Pike sometimes veers away from worshipping Sarenrae and wants to do bad things. I just want to do bad things with my friends! Hoodrat things with my friends. Sometimes she can't. There are consequences.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You make Sarenrae look really good on the outside.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, all right. I don't think Pike would ever be like, "You need to convert to Sarenrae because "you're a bad person." So no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You will never be those protesters outside of Comic-Con.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, never ever ever.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh man, can we do a photoshoot with Ashley with the sign for Sarenrae? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Standing out on a street corner at Comic-Con?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Done, we're doing it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, there's two sides to every battle. Not going to say any more than that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Someone said, I think it's supposed to be @Alkie on Twitter, "How did Mary Elizabeth and "other guests come about? Are you friends with them and they just wanted to join?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: My apologies. I was looking for another question, thinking that was to you. My apologies. Well--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Are they friends and wanted to join?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not really. Just kidding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mary had never played before and had not really exhibited interest when we first-- she was invited to the very first session that we were going to run, but she couldn't make it, she was like, "I don't know." But then hearing all the stories over the years of us playing privately, she was like, "Oh, this sounds like fun." I'm like, "Yeah, I already have too many players. Sorry."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Knew she'd be good at it, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: When we had the opportunity to bring guests on the show, it was like, oh, we have to see if Mary can make it. And Will, who I'd worked with on Thundercats and a few other projects between, he's a huge fantasy buff, as you've seen in the previous Q&A. He loves fantasy, but he'd never played an RPG before. We had conversations about D&D back when we began our campaign, and he kept asking about it, and I could see that twinkle in his eye of interest, and I was like, "Well, we have a guest spot coming up. Would you be "interested in playing?" He was like, "I have no idea what I'm doing. Sure." And so we got together at the Coral Cafe, and we built a character, went over the rules a bit, and he's like, "I still "don't know what I'm doing, but sure." And he did great, and the dynamic's been fantastic, and I'm glad they had an opportunity to actually play together when they came back for a couple episodes. That was cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Back in seven seconds.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love that, in classic Windows fashion, the tablet decided to update and restart in the middle of all this, so we don't have access to the chat anymore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll get back to you, chatroom, here, in a minute.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Machine guns are fancy and wonderful, but I'm shooting musket balls, so I don't even have bullet technology yet. And even with the lightning glove, I sent sketches of something that would sort of pretty much work. I don't know what would have happened if you hit it with lightning, but it was definitely a rudimentary electrical generation system that would have fit in a glove.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. There's, for Percy, this consideration of what your ideas are versus what, number one, would be functional in the world, two, how far, these designs, could you actually produce based on your experience in the engineering realm. Even things that were available in a historical sense, in certain time periods, those were people that spent their entire life steeped in these feats of engineering. Whenever you bring me an idea, it would be like trying to marry what you're trying to accomplish versus what would be viable within the game, and finding balance as it is, but an aspect of your class features.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have no interest in breaking the world any further than where his story is literally that he broke the world, which I'm sure will come up again at some point.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.text: It was like, oh, hey, guys, updating, because Windows.

lines.text: I've been using Windows 7 for so long, and every two days, it's like, "You want Windows 10? You

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With his funds that he was given, he was able to choose to spend it on items he wanted. He was like, "Oh, flying broom! That looks cool. I'll "take that." And I was like, "All right. I know who's going to want that." I immediately knew as soon as it happened, if he pulls that out, who's going to gun for it. And as soon as he did, Vex's eyes went--

lines.text: I wasn't expecting that to happen. I think Hardwick's still jokingly bent out of shape about it. I've seen him a few times. We went to Renn Faire the week before last, and he was like, "I "got to get my broom back, man." And I'm like, "Yeah, have fun with that. Good luck."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly. Arcane casters can be tricksy. I'm just glad he was able to guest. His schedule is so crazy. That was a lot of fun. Yeah, that broom was fully on him. He brought it and he lost it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because it would make the game interesting. It would totally shift the game pieces on the board and add new dynamics in unpredictable ways. I'm not treating it like a dating sim where the end result for me playing D&D was "winning the "princess". It's just to see how things could change in the next year of gameplay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Absolutely, there are decisions that you make that are specifically like, I don't want my character to learn that much that quickly. I don't want him to be that smart and that, "Well, I've "learned a valuable lesson about how to treat people and how to--" Nope! Here. Yours. Cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's been done this way for a year. Let's see what happens if we move this over here and that over there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A lot of people think I'm leading Vax on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ah, whatever. I'm having fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's fun. I'll say both Taliesin and Percy are really amused by the entire situation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Same. So is Ashley/Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not as fleshed out as others. Othanzia and Tal'Dorei are the two most fleshed out in my world, because those are the two where you guys have spent your most time. Whenever this game's done, we start a new campaign, it'll probably still be in Exandria, but it might start in Marquet. It might start somewhere else in the world and have a whole different cultural flavor and flair, and it'll be a whole different side to this world. And there'll be references to and history that exists that you would know, because you were part of it before, but you'll be a whole new group of adventurers in a whole different part of the world. That'll be fun.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would say part of the reason that I didn't want to fight Umbrasyl, most of it was because I didn't think we were ready. But part of it is because I'm looking at this game like a game of Fallout. I want to go to the corners of the map. I want to go to Marquet. I want to go to the bottom of the ocean. I want to go to all of these places where the Vestiges are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to go off the map!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we really mainlining the quest? Really? That's what we're doing? What about all these side things that Matt's got? I want to be a completionist.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's so much to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, it's so much fun to mess with them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: People have asked this before, but I actually like this question. "If you could play "another character in-game, who would you pick?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One of the other characters?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: One of the other characters.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill shit. It's great. He's like the polar opposite of Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It would be so nice. To be able to be reckless and not care. Break people's necks whenever I want to. Must be nice being Grog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would go Keyleth because I want access to the broad range of magic, and I've been so non-magic the entire time. I don't know shit about magic. I barely know anything. Yeah, Vax-- and side note, before we go into this game, Vax is totally impressed with Keyleth and thinks that she's the most powerful one in the group, and is in awe of it, and feels like a weak dingus, basically, in comparison to everybody. To everybody.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But you do so much damage!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's fine. Not Liam! Vax looks at everybody and is like, "Oh, my God! Look at you, "shining beacon of hope! Look at this crazy fucking motherfucker who can build stuff out of a tin can! "Look at Scanlan, staring into the maw of horror and stupidly thinking everything's okay! Look at "my sister, who's not scared of anything!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And look at how much we all hate ourselves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax is Sokka from Avatar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh! We've got to find Sokka a master! Got to find you your own sword!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've seen the first three seasons of Korra, but not the early one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seriously. It's great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I'll get there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are characters that have strong personality traits and they emerge themselves, because for an NPC, you have to make an impact quickly. You don't have a lot of time with them, and you want to try and make the world lively and interesting for your players. So I have certain personality points that are at the forefront of each personality. Gilmore to me was never a caricature, partially because I built him around somebody I used to do theater with when I was younger in high school, so I already had a personality print for him. But also I really wanted to show a character that could be ostentatious and flamboyant in a way that was fun and not a caricature. If that didn't come across, my apologies. Gilmore is a very charismatic, very outgoing salesman, and that's part of his job. He uses that to his advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's also very deep. I don't think any of us have looked at him as a one-dimensional character.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But people have their interpretations. I care very much about the character.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We didn't know what was coming. There was so much panache.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's his whole thing. He's a showman, and that's so much of his personality. And as you guys got to know him better, especially you, he let you peek behind the veil a bit and see--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, you peeked behind the veil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The world-wearied individual, there's a lot of depth to the character.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I love your Scarlet Pimpernel--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very much so. Percival from Scarlet Pimpernel-ish.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also someone was asking if he was based off of a real person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's also been one of the greatest pleasures for me for this game, because it wasn't anything that I saw coming. It was really funny and surprising the first time at home, and then he came back several times, and right from the first time that Gilmore appeared, he zeroed in on Vax and was sweet on Vax. It was nervous laughter the first time, and then slowly over time it got more charming, and more charming, up to the point where you guys have seen that probably Vax is legitimately taken with him, definitely intrigued by him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He charmed your pants off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gilmore's a great character, and Vax was definitely taken with him. We probably saw Gilmore two to three weeks of the last three years? Maybe more? I've traveled-- Vax and Keyleth, though, have been traveling together for years. So, I mean--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's a deep-rooted love.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will say on that fact, too, because someone asked this question, and they said there have been hints on the characters that have exhibited LGBT relationships in the game, but a lot of characters seem to be husband-and-wife-type personalities. Are those only a small number of people, and I'm like, no. I don't make a big deal of sexuality in the game unless it comes up, because I don't think it's something that should drive the story, it just exists in the world. I think there's relationships of all kinds in Exandria. And I think culturally, just like in the real world, some places it's more appropriate than not, based on wherever they live. It doesn't mean I agree with that, by any means. I believe love is love no matter where you find it. And there are places in Exandria where it is more acceptable than others. And that's a whole different story element that might come up depending on where you travel in the world, I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, guys, we're in Hollywood. We're all leftie communists. We're good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're all commies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But yeah. Like many writers, I err on the side of creating an interesting character who might happen to be gay. Or an interesting character that may happen to be bisexual. I try not to make that a defining characteristic of the personality, nor do I want to try and go out of my way to have a one-off NPC that you encounter be like, "Oh, by the way, I have a wife and I'm a "girl." Because that to me seems like it's forced, it's shoehorned and now it's not about the story, it's about that relationship, whereas if the relationship were to come about as part of the story then that's just how it is, because that's life.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's an RPG that does that. It's the most misogynist, awful RPG. It's a great example of how not to develop and design a game if you haven't seen it, or don't see it, it'll just make you angry. Don't look up FATAL.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. There's places you just don't go on the internet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, anyway. We got time for a few more questions before we take a break and go into the Battle Royale. For those guys who didn't have your questions answered tonight, I apologize, we've gotten a lot of questions. I'll try and go on the Reddit occasionally to answer questions through this thread in the coming months or so, off and on, and feel free to throw them back at us on Twitter afterward. We'll answer them as we can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Someone was asking for you to explain where the College of the Maestro came from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The sound of battle. The impact of a sword against a shield, or the sound of a creature chittering as it attacks, and mold it into a symphony, almost like a soundbender where they pull and turn it into music, and that was their basis. So instead of fighting with a weapon, they have a wand and an open hand, and they stand in the middle or the back of the battlefield and conduct it, like an orchestra conductor.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's rad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually I got really frustrated and was like, "I'm going to make this as a bard college "and we'll see if people like it." It's gotten a good response. It's still being tweaked. Anything homebrew you try and balance it as best you can. At first blast, I don't have a lot of time to really finetune it, and I wanted to get it out there to get the community response, and it's been really great. You guys have had great feedback and I'm tweaking things as we go, so there'll probably be a couple more updates in the next few weeks or months. So thank you all, people who have reached out and given comments on DMs Guild or on the Reddit thread. It's making its way towards hopefully being a fun option for those who want to try it out. If you don't like it, you don't have to play it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: People do keep asking who Pike is in love with, and same as what Liam said. We'll see. It might not ever happen in game. Maybe it won't. But she's in love with somebody. It's something that happened prior to playing the show. It was a moment that happened and feelings were formed. It might not even be somebody in the group. It could even be an NPC character.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's the forbidden love.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's Trinket. It's Trinket. God, you guys! Figured it out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: @CmdrDara on Twitter says, "How do I get my fellow party members to not be murderhobos?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good luck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a valuable lesson to learn. If it's a world which enables a murderhobo-type circumstance, that's different, and you can find narratives in there, but it's definitely more of an evil campaign, and a little harder to run unless you have some experience as a GM. But if it's something you don't want to happen in the game, keep in mind, there are ramifications for such horrible, murderous actions, which could lead to a really interesting story. Perhaps they killed a few people and they all of a sudden meet the families of these individuals, or the person that captures them is related to someone they murdered, and decides no, I'm not going to execute you, I'm going to make you work for me until you realize what you've done. Or perhaps a paladin or a cleric that actually feels sorry for them is like, "You did a horrible thing, but I don't understand why "you did this. I want to understand it. Until then, you're under my watch." Now they're working for this individual who is trying to understand how you were so corrupted as people. You can find different ways to turn that behavior into part of the story. But if it's just the players trolling you, maybe have a talk with your party to work with you and respect the time you've put into the game.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And what happens if your fellow party members are murderhobos and you're not?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then stand up. Stand up in the story and pull a Keyleth, and be like, "Guys, this is wrong!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: #PullAKeyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And if they turn around and stab your character to death? Perhaps this isn't the gaming group you should be hanging with.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe your DM could create an all-powerful hobo lich who could murder them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just like in real life, though, you really have to pick your friends. We've had games where not everyone's playing the same game, and it becomes a problem. I've been in that game several times in my life, where there's three different games happening. Find everybody who wants to play the game you want to play.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. And as a GM or DM, before you even start the game, have a conversation with all your players to discuss the kind of game you're all looking for. Be like, "Hey, guys, this is the kind "of game I want to run. And it's got some story, some intrigue, political elements, and some combat "balanced in." Some players may be like, "Oh, I just want to come in, kick down doors, kill shit "and take loot." You want to make sure you all are agreed upon the type of game you want to play, so you don't end up four games in before everyone hates each other. I will also--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got one here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This one kind of amused me. Stefan Pennington said, "You said what your characters' "greatest flaws were. What do you think your characters' greatest virtues are?", which I thought was funny. We've never talk about what's good about our characters very often, because what's wrong with us is so much more interesting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That is true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Percy I would say is-- he is genuinely filled with gratitude towards the people who saved him from the abyss that he was falling into. He is very grateful. He is many, many things, but he is deeply, deeply grateful for the people in his life, and is willing to do some dumb stuff that he knows is dumb because of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. I want to hear what I'm going to be killing in here. Let me know what dies tonight.

No, I know!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel like she doesn't know that, but--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know that, but she's-- I don't think she realizes the influences that-- I don't think she actually realizes the power of her influence that she actually can wield for the better.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so glad that she hasn't learned the mom voice yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. Pike gets close.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not angry, I'm just disappointed. Oh my god.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike has gotten close a few times with Grog, with her-- you're like, one look, man. One look, Grog.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I've got it down to a look instead of a word. I think that was a moment in game of me with Travis being, stop it! Do not die again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's pretty great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're not going to clean this up afterwards, we're going to cut it off right now!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: When I watched it back, I was-- when I watched it back, when I saw the little gif, I was like, yikes! I was so intense.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Colin Dorrey @e_jeansegast asks, "Speaking of Gilmore, is Vax bisexual?" Duh. Good question.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Three on the Kinsey scale.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Remember, I came into this -- we went from Pathfinder to Fifth Edition when we started the stream, really our first time playing Fifth Edition, so there's been balancing lessons learned as we progress, and a lot of circumstances that caught me and the players off-guard as far as difficulty. That's part of the fun of the game. So for me, it's learning through experience, previous encounters, learning the players' strengths and weaknesses, and finding ways to tweak creatures that better fit those to be a real challenge when it has to be and to not be a real challenge when it doesn't have to be. Not every battle has to be a fight to the death, to the teeth ever, because sometimes fights are enjoyable for players to show up and fight basilisks that once tore them asunder and be like, oh, we come back and we tear you down! It's fun to have those quick victories sometimes. But yeah, you have to find it through practice, and the DMG scaling does help a lot, but on this level, this size of a party with what they have at their disposal, I kind of have to wing a lot of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Raistlin level.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do we have-- does this go towards anything, like is this extra credit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is for the bragging rights of saying you can beat the shit out of the rest of your own party.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a fun one for me. Someone said, "What characters do your kids play? Would you ever "introduce Vax or Vox Machina into their quests?" I hadn't thought of that. I'm going to do it. Thank you for the suggestion. I started with my son who's nine. He's with three boys, and my son is a half-elf druid with a dragonborn fighter and a dragonborn rogue. Then my daughter got interested, so I started doing a separate game with my daughter and my son where my son plays a dwarven wizard and my daughter plays an elven druid, and then my daughter got into it, so now I'm doing one with four girls where my daughter is a gnome rogue, and there's a gnome cleric, and there is a gnome druid, and a human monk. And I am up to my neck in Dungeons and Dragons lately, thank you Matthew Mercer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You're welcome. Someone send him some Best Dad awards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because Ashley made a Keyleth killing a child joke, now I got the questions, "Were there "ramifications for Keyleth killing the child?" Yeah.

lines.text: But it was the-- one of the funniest moments in the game? It was-- For me, I thought it was so funny, which is terrible. Because you were just doing this amazing thing--

lines.text: You're all learning a lot about Ashley right now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know. I think, if I ever rolled another character, it would be the most evil, terrible person.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I think you have to.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: For me, I thought it was kind of funny because you were like, I just want to help! And then he was like, and you killed a child.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, it's not real. You know, it's paper and dice.

lines.text: And it's really hard to find a greeting card for that. Like, I've been looking for years to find a pop-up-- snap!

lines.text: Hey, sorry you killed a child. Oh god, oh god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's horrible, that's horrible!
